ing: 1 (1.5 liter) bottle Burgundy or other red wine
1/2 teaspoon Sweet'N Low granulated sugar substitute
1 orange, chilled and cut into wedges
des: "Lots of citrus flavors and sliced fresh fruit make a refreshing red-wine sangria, and this recipe makes enough for a crowd."
ins: In large pitcher or punch bowl, stir together juices, wine, and Sweet 'N Low until Sweet 'N Low dissolves; refrigerate until well chilled. Just before serving, add seltzer, orange wedges, lemon slices, and strawberry slices.
